thread.title: Dating App Projects Steamy Mock-Up of Trump and Putin on NYC Buildings For Valentine’s Day
thread.title_full: Dating App Projects Steamy Mock-Up of Trump and Putin on NYC Buildings For Valentine’s Day

author: Lindsey Ellefson
title: Dating App Projects Steamy Mock-Up of Trump and Putin on NYC Buildings For Valentine’s Day
text:
Dating App Projects Steamy Mock-Up of Trump and Putin on NYC Buildings For Valentine’s Day by Lindsey Ellefson | 5:13   
Did you take a cutie on a Valentine’s date last night in New York City? If you did, did you happen to see the following image projected on any buildings? 
A lot of people did, actually, because Hater , a dating app designed to match singles with people who hate the same things they do, projected it on buildings at 15th Street and 9th Avenue and 14th Street and 8th Avenue in Manhattan, plus North 6th and Wythe in Brooklyn. 
When we asked Hater for a quote, here’s what we got: 
There’s a lot of animosity out there, regardless of what side you’re on. We’re just trying to make people laugh. Through humor, hate can turn into love. 
As it stands right now, it’s almost impossible to know if what really exists between the image’s subjects — Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin — is love, but funny Valentine’s Day gags are a marketing staple , so we have to hand it to the people behind the app. With any luck, people who hate Trump and Putin (or people who hate large-scale marketing stunts!) can unite over the image on Hater. 
[images via Hater]
